node.title: Billionaire with 'rapacious appetite' for stolen antiquities agrees to hand over nearly $100m in looted artefacts
node.alt: An older white man with glasses smiles for the camera.
node.description: Michael Steinhardt cut deals with "tomb raiders" to get his hands on looted artefacts from countries including Greece, Israel and Iraq, according to New York prosecutors.
node.content:
["A billionaire US hedge fund manager with a \"rapacious\" appetite for looted artefacts has agreed to turn over $US70 million ($99 million) worth of stolen antiquities and will be banned from buying any more for the rest of his life, Manhattan's District Attorney says.", "In return, Michael Steinhardt will not face criminal charges for acquiring pieces that were smuggled out of 11 countries including Egypt, Greece, Israel, Syria and Turkey, prosecutors said.", "\"For decades, Michael Steinhardt displayed a rapacious appetite for plundered artefacts\u00a0without concern for the legality of his actions, the legitimacy of the pieces he bought and sold, or the grievous cultural damage he wrought across the globe,\" District Attorney Cyrus Vance Jr\u00a0said in a news release.", "Mr Vance said his probe, begun in February 2017, found \"compelling evidence\" that the 180 antiquities were stolen from 11 countries, with at least 171 passing through traffickers before Mr Steinhardt bought them.", "Mr Steinhardt said in a prepared statement issued by his attorneys that he was \"pleased that the District Attorney's years-long investigation has concluded without any charges and that items wrongfully taken by others will be returned to their native countries.\"", "According to a 142-page statement of facts, 138 of the antiquities came from Greece, Israel or Italy, and Mr Steinhardt once acknowledged that a majority of items he bought from one dealer \"did not have provenance.\"", "According to prosecutors, while complaining about a subpoena requesting documentation for an antiquity in May 2017, Mr Steinhardt pointed to a small chest from Greece and said to an investigator:\u00a0\"You see this piece? There's no provenance for it. If I see a piece and I like it, then I buy it.\"", "", "
This ceremonial chest from 1,300 BC was purchased from a known antiquities trafficker.(Supplied: New York District Attorney's Office)
", "Many of the pieces Mr Steinhardt acquired were removed from their countries of origin during times of war or civil unrest, prosecutors said.", "Manhattan prosecutors began investigating Mr Steinhardt's collection of ancient artefacts in 2017 and raided his office and his Manhattan home in 2018, seizing several artworks that investigators said had been looted.", "The items surrendered by Mr Steinhardt include a stag's head in the form of a ceremonial drinking vessel, dating from 400 BC, that Mr Steinhardt loaned to the Metropolitan Museum of Art in 1993.", "Prosecutors said the head, valued at $US3.5 million, appeared without provenance on the international market after rampant looting in Milas, Turkey.", "The stag's head had been \"found in Western Turkey,\" according to undated handwritten notes in Mr Steinhardt's records.", "", "
Mr Steinhardt loaned this stag's head to the Metropolitan Museum of Art in 1993.(Supplied: New York District Attorney's Office)
", "The Greek chest, from the island of Crete,\u00a0was designed for holding human remains. Called a \"larnax\" and\u00a0dating from around 1,300BC, prosecutors said it was purchased from a known antiquities trafficker.", "A gold bowl in the collection was first trafficked after Islamic State looted cultural heritage from the ancient Assyrian city of\u00a0Nimrud in Iraq.", "The antiquities will be returned to their rightful owners in Bulgaria, Egypt, Greece, Iraq, Israel, Italy, Jordan, Lebanon, Libya, Syria and Turkey, according to Mr Vance.", "Law enforcement in these countries helped in the probe.", "", "
This gold bowl was looted from Nimrud, Iraq.(Supplied: New York District Attorney's Office)
", "Mr Steinhardt, who turns 81 on Tuesday, founded the hedge fund Steinhardt Partners in 1967 and closed it in 1995. He came out of retirement in 2004 to head Wisdom Tree Investments.", "He is also a philanthropist, chair of the Steinhardt Foundation for Jewish Life and co-founder of Birthright Israel, an organisation that sends young Jewish people on free trips to Israel.", "New York University named its Steinhardt School of Culture, Education and Human Development after him in recognition of two $US10 million donations.", "AP/Reuters"]
